info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 2:36PM CDT until April 7 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis TN
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...A portion of East Arkansas, including the following county, Poinsett.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT Monday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Several structures are already flooded. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 236 PM CDT, Emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. - Local rivers will continue to rise and remain elevated through at least midweek. Additional flooding impacts are expected across a large portion of the county. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Trumann, Marked Tree, Harrisburg, Lepanto, Tyronza, Weiner, Waldenburg, Greenfield, Fisher, Whitaker, Landers, Weona, McCormick, Weona Junction, Promised Land, Old Weona, Stewart, Bay Village, Maple Grove and Wiley Crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT MONDAY
